decks.notes: This five-color control deck revolves around utilizing a variety of powerful spells to control the game and outvalue the opponent. With a mix of counterspells, removal, card draw, and powerful planeswalkers like Nicol Bolas and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, the deck aims to consistently disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage. The commander, Child of Alara, serves as a board wipe option when needed, further adding to the deck's control elements. Additionally, the deck includes a wide range of lands to ensure access to all colors of mana, allowing for flexibility in casting spells and ensuring a stable mana base throughout the game.

The deck revolves around utilizing Geist of Saint Traft as the commander to control the game through counterspells, removal, and disruption. The main focus is on maintaining tempo and control over the opponents' strategy by deploying efficient counterspells like Counterspell and Mana Leak, along with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Council's Judgment. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Ancestral Vision and Dig Through Time to ensure a steady stream of resources. Additionally, it features creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Vendilion Clique to provide additional value and disruption. The mana base is designed to support the control strategy by providing access to different colors and utility lands like Wasteland and Tectonic Edge for disruption.

The deck revolves around using counterspells and disruption to control the game while also applying pressure with efficient creatures and equipment. By efficiently disrupting the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to maintain a balance between protecting its own threats and applying pressure to win the game quickly. With a strong mana base and a variety of versatile spells, the deck is able to adapt to different matchups and react to various situations. Overall, the strategy of the deck is to establish early board presence, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and close out the game with powerful threats and equipment.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using various spells and mana dorks to cast powerful threats such as Avenger of Zendikar and Craterhoof Behemoth. Being able to quickly establish a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures is key to this aggressive strategy. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Reclamation Sage and Acidic Slime to deal with any opposing threats, while also utilizing cards like Sylvan Library and Primeval Titan to maintain card advantage and search for key cards. Overall, the goal is to quickly build a formidable board state and pressure the opponent with high-powered creatures while disrupting their game plan with versatile removal options.

The key concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana using Elf creatures and various ramp cards in order to execute a combo finish. The deck includes cards like Marath, Will of the Wild and various other Elf creatures that can tap for mana or generate additional mana. It also includes cards like Fertile Ground, Wild Growth, and Utopia Sprawl to further ramp up mana production. Once a sufficient amount of mana has been generated, the deck aims to use combo cards like Earthcraft, Birthing Pod, and Primal Surge to create an overwhelming advantage and potentially win the game in a single turn. Overall, the deck's focus is on ramping up mana quickly and efficiently, and then using powerful combo cards to secure victory.

This deck focuses on efficiently ramping mana with various mana dorks and lands to support a wide range of powerful creatures and spells. The main strategy is to swarm the board with creatures that can quickly apply pressure to the opponent and take advantage of Marath's ability to generate tokens and deal damage. The deck also includes various utility creatures and removal spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a mix of aggression and versatility, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of threats and disruptive plays to secure victory in one-on-one matches.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a combination of counter spells, removal, card draw, and recursion. Tasigur, as the commander, allows for card advantage and recursion by utilizing his ability to delve cards from the graveyard. The deck includes a high density of counterspells such as Force of Will, Mana Leak, and Counterspell to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Removal spells like Abrupt Decay, Toxic Deluge, and Pernicious Deed help keep the board clear of threats. Card draw spells like Mystic Confluence and Ancestral Vision provide the deck with additional resources. Overall, the key concept of the deck is to maintain control of the game through disruption and card advantage until it can establish a winning position.

The deck focuses on utilizing Yisan, the Wanderer Bard's ability to tutor creatures from the deck to build a strong board presence quickly. By ramping mana with cards like Birds of Paradise and Elvish Mystic, the deck aims to establish a mana advantage and play large threats like Craterhoof Behemoth and Primeval Titan to quickly overrun the opponent. Cards like Birthing Pod and Green Sun's Zenith provide additional tutoring options, while utility creatures like Eternal Witness and Reclamation Sage offer flexibility in dealing with various threats. Additionally, disruptive cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Phyrexian Revoker help control the board while advancing the deck's game plan of aggressive creature-based strategies.

This deck focuses on using Animar, Soul of Elements to ramp up quickly and play a wide variety of creatures with different abilities and effects to create powerful combos. The deck includes a mix of mana accelerators, card draw spells, utility creatures, and powerful finishers like Craterhoof Behemoth and Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker. The goal is to quickly build up Animar's counters, reduce the cost of casting creatures, and overwhelm the opponent with a big board presence. The deck also includes disruption elements like counterspells and removal spells to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's plans. It aims to win the game through explosive turns and overwhelming the opponent with its synergistic creature interactions.

The deck is built around the concept of utilizing aggressive creatures with high toughness, such as Doran, the Siege Tower, to quickly and efficiently deal damage to the opponent. This strategy is supported by a wide range of mana-fixing lands and powerful removal spells to control the board. The deck also includes various creatures and spells that disrupt the opponent's strategy, such as Aven Mindcensor and Council's Judgment. Additionally, the deck features powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Feast and Famine to enhance the effectiveness of its creatures in combat. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures, removal spells, and disruption tactics.

The primary focus of this deck is to control the game through a variety of counterspells, bounce spells, and card draw engines, with Jace, Vryn's Prodigy as the commander. The goal is to disrupt your opponent's plans while building up card advantage and eventually setting up a win condition. This deck features a wide range of instants, sorceries, and artifacts to help you control the board and outmaneuver your opponent. By efficiently using your resources and planning ahead, you can dictate the pace of the game and carefully navigate your way to victory.	Commander: Jace, Vryn's Prodigy	main strategy: Control	the art of one vs one Duel Commander format.

The deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and powerful disruption spells to control the game while applying pressure on the opponent. Jenara, Asura of War serves as a versatile and resilient commander that can quickly close out games with commander damage. The deck includes a mix of strong removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Council's Judgment, along with counterspells such as Force of Will and Cryptic Command to protect its threats. It also includes efficient mana acceleration in the form of mana dorks like Birds of Paradise and Noble Hierarch to ramp into its powerful spells and creatures. Overall, the deck's strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats that can quickly end the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing Meren of Clan Nel Toth's ability to reanimate creatures from the graveyard to create powerful combos. By filling the graveyard with creatures using cards like Entomb and Buried Alive, the deck can then bring them back with Meren's ability and other reanimation spells like Reanimate. Cards like Phyrexian Devourer and Triskelion can create infinite combos for massive damage, while other creatures like Sidisi, Undead Vizier provide utility and card advantage. The deck also includes strong removal and disruption spells like Abrupt Decay and Thoughtseize to control the board and protect the combo pieces. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents with its graveyard synergy and efficient combos.

This deck focuses on utilizing creatures with abilities that help generate value and fuel an aggressive game plan. By utilizing Sidisi, Brood Tyrant as the commander, the deck aims to create a constant stream of zombie tokens while also self-milling to fuel graveyard interactions. The deck includes powerful cards like Fauna Shaman, Survival of the Fittest, and Recurring Nightmare to consistently find and recur key threats. In addition, the deck includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and creatures with enter the battlefield abilities to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures, graveyard synergies, and disruptive elements to secure a quick victory in a Duel Commander 1 vs 1 format.

The deck revolves around utilizing Yisan, the Wanderer Bard's ability to tutor for creatures of various converted mana costs to ramp up and overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of threats. The focus is on efficiently ramping up mana with cards like Birds of Paradise, Elvish Mystic, and Llanowar Elves, while also generating card advantage with Sylvan Library and Skullclamp. This deck aims to establish a board presence early on with mana dorks and then use Yisan's ability to search for powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth and Primeval Titan to quickly close out the game. With a strong mana base and a toolbox of creatures to choose from, the deck aims to be fast and aggressive in order to dominate the opponent in a Duel Commander setting.

The primary focus of this deck is to utilize Yisan, the Wanderer Bard's ability to tutor for creatures of varying mana costs to create a fast and efficient aggro strategy. By ramping mana with cards like Karametra's Acolyte and Elvish Archdruid, and utilizing cards like Earthcraft and Concordant Crossroads to generate additional value from creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a wide array of powerful creatures such as Craterhoof Behemoth and Primeval Titan. Additionally, cards like Sylvan Library and Survival of the Fittest provide card selection and creature tutoring to ensure a consistent and strong board presence. Overall, the deck aims for a proactive playstyle, using Yisan's ability to rapidly assemble a threatening board state and quickly close out the game.
